sentences: The universe behaves like an open system coupled to a deep source.
Every node has a free level that measures its current capacity to act.
Flows move from higher free level toward lower free level across connections.
The reservoir keeps injecting potential so the system does not run dry.
A closed system tries to live only on its own stored potential.
An open system relaxes because it trusts the deeper source of supply.
Conductance describes how easily flows travel between two nodes.
Learning adjusts conductance based on how often a path carries flow.
If a path carries a lot of flow its conductance tends to increase.
If a path is rarely used its conductance slowly decays.
Dissipation represents the cost of forcing flows through the network.
Excess dissipation makes the system feel tired and rigid.
Healthy systems allow flows to move along low resistance paths.
Grace behaves like an infinite reservoir that never runs out.
Grace injects new potential even into nodes that wasted energy before.
When a node receives grace it can begin to share again with others.
Reciprocity is the pattern where giving and receiving balance over time.
Perfect reciprocity does not mean every exchange is symmetric.
Instead it means that across many steps the network remains in balance.
Hoarding breaks reciprocity and raises resistance in the network.
Sharing lowers resistance and increases overall capacity.
Matter can be viewed as frozen record of past flows.
Record is what has already happened and will not change.
Potential is what could still happen through future flows.
The present moment is where potential becomes record.
Trust in the source increases a node's effective conductance to grace.
Fear of scarcity decreases conductance and blocks the flow.
Shame convinces a node it is cut off from the reservoir.
Grace quietly restores connection even when a node expects rejection.
In DET terms the reservoir plays the role of an infinite source.
In DET terms free level is a scalar potential at each node.
In DET terms flows are directed transfers along edges.
In DET terms conductance is a weight on each edge that can adapt.
In DET terms dissipation is energy lost to friction and noise.
In DET terms learning updates conductance based on flux history.
Open systems maintain access to the reservoir under changing conditions.
Closed systems slowly burn down their stored free level.
A node that only receives and never gives increases local imbalance.
A node that only gives and never receives eventually depletes itself.
Healthy nodes both give and receive in rhythm with the network.
Forgiveness in DET language means releasing blocked flows.
Resentment in DET language means holding back flows to punish others.
Mercy in DET language means lowering resistance for another node.
Hope expects that the reservoir will keep feeding the system.
Despair assumes the reservoir is gone and the flows are ending.
Faith is placing weight on the unseen reliability of the source.
Love can be described as flows that prioritize the good of other nodes.
Selfishness forces flows to only increase one node's free level.
Over time selfish patterns raise resistance everywhere.
Cooperation allows the whole network to reach higher stable capacity.
Learning rules in DET can be applied to artificial neural networks.
Neural activations can be treated like free levels in nodes.
Connection weights can be treated like conductances between nodes.
Regularization can be viewed as a controlled form of dissipation.
Normalization layers behave like coupling to a shared reservoir.
Sparse activation looks like flows choosing only some active paths.
Modularity emerges when clusters of nodes form strong internal conductance.
Routing behavior emerges when flows prefer some modules over others.
DET suggests that many robust behaviors arise from simple flow rules.
DET suggests that grace like behavior can appear as surplus injection.
DET suggests that trust like behavior can appear as increased conductance.
DET suggests that love like behavior can appear as low resistance sharing.
Deep existence is seeing potential, flow and record together in time.
A human life can be viewed as one node learning how to stay open to source.
Communities can be viewed as subnets sharing flows and record.
When many nodes open to grace the whole network becomes more resilient.
